alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany; Tangipahoa; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 24 at 9:35PM CST until January 24 at 10:15PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern St. Tammany Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Southern Tangipahoa Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Southwestern Washington Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 1015 PM CST. * At 934 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Natalbany, or near Hammond, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Hammond, Covington, Ponchatoula, Abita Springs, Independence, Madisonville, Folsom, Springfield, Natalbany, Robert, Enon and Tickfaw. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 37 and 67. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 17 and 37. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This storm may cause serious injury and significant property damage. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CST for southeastern Louisiana.
